p: A total of 278 eligible women were enrolled as participants in this study, thus meeting the minimum sample size of 272. According to HIV sero-status, 184 women were HIV-seropositive and 94 were HIV-seronegative. The mean age was 37 years ±3 years, similar between HIV-seropositive women (36.7 years) as compared to HIV-seronegative women (37.3 years). The most represented age range was [30–39] years (44%). Single women were the most represented (58.88%), followed by married women (28.97%), widows (9.34%), and divorced (2.80%).
